<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> /kind bug


**What happened**:
When accessing a service (e.g., `zipkin`) by using the Apiserver proxy feature and the service returns `302 Found` with `Location` header, such as
```
curl http://159.146.11.73:8080/api/v1/namespaces/default/services/zipkin/proxy/ -vvv
... 
< HTTP/1.1 302 Found
< Location: http://159.146.11.73:8080/zipkin/
...
```
The returned `Location` header does not preserve the `api/v1/namespaces/.../proxy/` path if the service sent a redirect with an absolute path. 

Depending on the cluster, the `Location` header written by the service itself might have been `< Location: http://zipkin:9411/zipkin/` and the apiserver proxy did rewrite the _host_:_port_ to match the correct values. Unfortunately, it did not rewrite the path segment. 

**What you expected to happen**:
I would expect the apiserver to rewrite the path segment of the `Location` response header so that it reflects the fact that it's proxied under the `api/v1/.../proxy/` path:
```
< HTTP/1.1 302 Found
< Location: http://159.146.11.73:8080/api/v1/namespaces/default/services/zipkin/proxy/zipkin/
```

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
```
export KUBECONFIG=/path/to/your/kubeconfig

# use Helm to install Istio which includes Zipkin, unfortunately, there is no Chart for Zipkin only
helm repo add incubator http://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-charts-incubator
helm install --name test incubator/istio

kubectl proxy
curl -vvv http://localhost:8001/api/v1/namespaces/default/services/test-istio-zipkin:http/proxy/
...
< HTTP/1.1 302 Found
< Location: http://localhost:8001/zipkin/
< Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
...
```
The `/api/v1/namespaces/default/services/test-istio-zipkin:http/proxy` path was not preserved. 

**Anything else we need to know?**:
To work around this issue, a service may return strictly a relative url in the `Location` header such as:
```
< Location: ./zipkin/
```
The feature to rewrite `Location` headers is quite common. For instance, Apache Httpd does it thanks to: http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_proxy.html#proxypassreverse

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
% kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7", GitVersion:"v1.7.5", GitCommit:"17d7182a7ccbb167074be7a87f0a68bd00d58d97", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-08-31T19:32:12Z", GoVersion:"go1.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7", GitVersion:"v1.7.2", GitCommit:"922a86cfcd65915a9b2f69f3f193b8907d741d9c", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-07-21T08:08:00Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: _custom_
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): `Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS`
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): `4.4.0-89-generic`
